title: How to Make Pancake Batter

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
steps.description: Slowly pour in the milk and mix well.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, vanilla, and vegetable oil.
steps.description: Whisk the batter thoroughly until there are no more lumps.

steps.headline: Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat.
steps.description: Coat with a non-stick cooking spray, butter, or vegetable oil to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter onto the pan and cook each side until it is golden brown.
steps.description: Use a spatula to flip the pancakes and to remove them when they are finished.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Add fruit, maple syrup, whipped cream, or powdered sugar if desired.

text: Basic Pancake Batter Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Slowly pour in the milk and mix well. Add the eggs, vanilla, and vegetable oil. Whisk the batter thoroughly until there are no more lumps. Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat. Coat with a non-stick cooking spray, butter, or vegetable oil to prevent sticking. Spoon the batter onto the pan and cook each side until it is golden brown. Use a spatula to flip the pancakes and to remove them when they are finished. Serve immediately. Add fruit, maple syrup, whipped cream, or powdered sugar if desired. Gluten-Free Pancake Batter Mix the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Add the eggs, water, and oil and whisk the batter until the lumps are gone. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat with non-stick cooking spray, butter, or vegetable oil to prevent sticking. Spoon the batter onto the skillet and cook until bubbles form. Flip the pancake over with a spatula and cook until both sides are golden brown. Serve immediately. Add maple syrup, fruit, whipped cream, walnuts, and other toppings if desired. Finished.
